name: Edith Creek Canyon
description:
Mount Rainier will be instituting a "pilot" *timed entry system in 2024, from Memorial Day-Labor Day.

Some key points:

  • no reservation is needed before 7am
  • no limit on how long you stay
  • each vehicle must have a unique timed entry ticket, and must enter during that 2 hour window.
  • reservations are through recreation.gov, and timelines for when they open are on the website below

What this means for most of us: For canyons along the paradise/stevens canyon corridor, July trips need to be planned by April 1, August trips by May 1, and either plan on one vehicle only, or have at least 2 of your team identified (and plan to be in separate vehicles) -OR- just plan to enter the park before 7am

Approach

Descent

  • R1: 100' - DCR tree. Do not rappel from the bridge or any other structure. This falls is called Myrtle Falls.

There are a few small cascades and waterfalls that can be rappelled or downclimbed. All rappels, except R1, can be anchored from slings around rocks.

  • R2: 40' - free rappel directly in water course. This falls is called Edith Gorge Falls

Exit

Red tape

Beta sites

  • Super Amazing Map  : Edith Creek Canyon
  • CanyoneeringNorthwest.com (archive.org)  : Edith Creek
